channel.title: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program
channel.description:
Steam announces a new program that allows you to share your Steam library of games with close friends and family.
[url='https://store.steampowered.com/sharing/']https://store.steampowered.com/sharing/[/url]

item.title: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Me and my brother have totally different Steam libraries and we use the same computer. This is actually perfect.

GG, Steam.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program

item.title: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
When the hell are they going to let the same account sign into multiple computers at once for small scale LAN games? I am so annoyed that I can’t play Ghost Recon with anybody on a network because Steam needs to flex it’s DRM muscles.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program

item.title: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program
item.dc:creator: Swaggless
item.description:
So, if my friend is playing Half-Life 2, borrowed from my library, and I log in and start to play Sonic Generations, they get kicked out? I guess I understand the reasoning, though it seems a bit strange and over-protective.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Family Sharing Of Games Program
